qas.question: What is the name of the 1801 document that aimed for reconcilliation between revolutionaries and Catholics?
Along with Napoleon, who signed the Concordat of 1801?
The Concordat of 1801 strengthened the position of which church as the majority church of France?
What is the exact date on which the Concordat of 1801 was signed?
What were the Organic Articles a part of?

context: Seeking national reconciliation between revolutionaries and Catholics, <a0_0>the Concordat of 1801<a0_0/> was signed on <a3_0>15 July 1801<a3_0/> between Napoleon and <a1_0>Pope Pius VII<a1_0/>. It solidified <a2_0>the Roman Catholic Church<a2_0/> as the majority church of France and brought back most of its civil status. The hostility of devout Catholics against the state had now largely been resolved. It did not restore the vast church lands and endowments that had been seized during the revolution and sold off. As a part of <a4_0>the Concordat<a4_0/>, he presented another set of laws called the Organic Articles.
